member.name: T:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iPortR2

member.remarks: The i-PORT R2's firmware is identical to an i-CARD CF "B". Once the reader is powered on, it continuously listens for beaconing tags.

The reader did not respond in a timely manner.

The reader did not respond in a timely manner.

member.summary: Suspends character transmission and places the transmission line in a break state until the ClearCommBreak function is called (or EscapeCommFunction is called with the CLRBREAK extended function code). member.summary: Restores character transmission and places the transmission line in a nonbreak state. The CLRBREAK extended function code is identical to the ClearCommBreak function

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.ITagReaderIQ.WriteTagDataWithCRCAndLength(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes data to a tag with a crc and a known length.
member.param: the tag to write formatted data to.
The memory address to store the data.
The number of bytes to write from byData on to the tag.
member.returns: A reference to a TagWriteDataResult object.
member.remarks: A 5 byte header is actually written to the tag at the address specified. If you try to read the data raw at this address, you will read the header. Therefore the actual amount of data you write on the tag is bytesToWrite + 5.
member.exception: Thrown when reading/writing the communications port that the iCard is connected to fails.
Low level communications error with the reader.
Low level communications timeout with the reader. The host did not receive a response from the reader within the expected timeframe.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.ITagReaderIQ.ReadiQLTagMarkerInfo(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag)
member.summary: Reads Marker info off of i-Q tags with the "L" indicator on the label.
member.returns: A Tags.LoopData object.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.ITagReaderIQ.ReadIQTagAbsoluteEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag)
member.summary: Reads the total hours logged by the tag (6 minute resolution). For i-Q8C tags only.
member.remarks: The IQ8C has a combined PNP/NPN input to recognise pulses or a high/low status. This input is polled every 2 seconds and when active increments the hour counter in RAM. If the RAM hour counter reaches the value for 6 minutes (1/10 hour), the hour counter in EEPROM is incremented. Also a absolute hour counter(not user writeable) is updated.
member.returns: The total amount of time the engine has been running for.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.ITagReaderIQ.ReadIQTagUserEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag)
member.summary: Reads the user engine counter value from the tag (6 minute resolution). For i-Q8C tags only.
member.returns: The amount of time the engine has been running for as specified by the user counter.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.ITagReaderIQ.WriteIQTagUserEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Writes the specified amount of time to the user/trip hour meter. Typically used to set the time back to zero. For i-Q8C tags only.
member.param: The amount of time to reset the user counter to. In a resolution of 6 minutes.
member.remarks: The counter is reported in 6 minute increments (10x per hour). Any value lesser or greater will be rounded.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.ITagReaderID2.BlinkTag(IDENTEC.Tags.iD2Tag,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Int32)
member.summary: Invokes the i-D2 tag to blink autonomously by specifying how many blinks and customizing the flashing behavior.
member.exception: The LED off time exceeds 2.55 seconds.
The blink count exceeds 255 seconds.
member.param: The amount of time the tag LED is to stay on (in 10ms steps), maximum of 2.55 seconds.
The amount of time the tag LED is to stay off (in 10ms steps), maximum of 2.55 seconds. 0 for continuous on.
The number of blinks to perform. O to turn off (if already blinking) and 255 maximum.
member.returns: True if successful, false if it fails
member.remarks: With continuous on set, the LED on time is repeated for the blink count. For example 2.55 seconds on time x 255 blinks = 650.25 seconds (nearly 11 minutes).

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iCard3.WriteTagDataWithCRCAndLength(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes data to a tag with a crc and a known length.
member.param: the tag to write formatted data to.
The memory address to store the data.
The number of bytes to write from byData on to the tag.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iCard3.ReadIQTagAbsoluteEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag)
member.summary: Reads the total hours logged by the tag (6 minute resolution). For i-Q8C tags only.
member.remarks: The IQ8C has a combined PNP/NPN input to recognise pulses or a high/low status. This input is polled every 2 seconds and when active increments the hour counter in RAM. If the RAM hour counter reaches the value for 6 minutes (1/10 hour), the hour counter in EEPROM is incremented. Also a absolute hour counter(not user writeable) is updated.
member.returns: The total amount of time the engine has been running for.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iCard3.ReadIQTagUserEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag)
member.summary: Reads the user engine counter value from the tag (6 minute resolution). For i-Q8C tags only.
member.returns: The amount of time the engine has been running for as specified by the user counter.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iCard3.WriteIQTagUserEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Writes the specified amount of time to the user/trip hour meter. Typically used to set the time back to zero. For i-Q8C tags only.
member.param: The amount of time to reset the user counter to. In a resolution of 6 minutes.
member.remarks: The counter is reported in 6 minute increments (10x per hour). Any value lesser or greater will be rounded.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iCard3.BlinkTag(IDENTEC.Tags.iD2Tag,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Int32)
member.summary: Invokes the i-D2 tag to blink autonomously by specifying how many blinks and customizing the flashing behavior.
member.exception: The LED off time exceeds 2.55 seconds.
The blink count exceeds 255 seconds.
member.param: The amount of time the tag LED is to stay on (in 10ms steps), maximum of 2.55 seconds.
The amount of time the tag LED is to stay off (in 10ms steps), maximum of 2.55 seconds. 0 for continuous on.
The number of blinks to perform. O to turn off (if already blinking) and 255 maximum.
member.returns: True if successful, false if it fails
member.remarks: With continuous on set, the LED on time is repeated for the blink count. For example 2.55 seconds on time x 255 blinks = 650.25 seconds (nearly 11 minutes).

member.summary: The active antenna. If iCard3 is connected to a multiplexer the card can control up to 4 antennas.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Readers.iCard3.EnableWakeupTagsDuringScan
member.summary: When enabled the tags are sent a wakeup call during scan. The default value is true.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Readers.iCard3.EnableReceiveBoost
member.summary: The RF receive boost. Enabling makes the card more sensitive to RF signals from tags. The default value is true.

member.summary: When enabled the session address is changed by the card for each scan. The default value is true.

member.summary: Writes a string to the tag.
member.param: The tag to write the string to.
The text to write to the tag.
member.returns: true if successful, false if it fails.
member.remarks: Only standard ASCII text is valid. Extended characters are not compatible. Uses WriteTagDataWithCRCAndLength
member.exception: Thrown when reading/writing the communications port that the i-CARD is connected to fails.

Low level communications timeout with the reader. The host did not receive a response from the reader within the expected timeframe.
text is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iCardCF.WriteTagDataWithCRCAndLength(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes data to a tag with a crc and a known length.
member.param: the tag to write formatted data to.
The memory address to store the data.
The number of bytes to write from byData on to the tag.
member.returns: A reference to a TagWriteDataResult object.
member.remarks: A 5 byte header is actually written to the tag at the address specified. If you try to read the data raw at this address, you will read the header. Therefore the actual amount of data you write on the tag is bytesToWrite + 5.
member.exception: Thrown when reading/writing the communications port that the i-CARD is connected to fails.
Low level communications error with the reader.
Low level communications timeout with the reader. The host did not receive a response from the reader within the expected timeframe.
text is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iCardCF.ReadIQTagAbsoluteEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag)
member.summary: Reads the total hours logged by the tag (6 minute resolution). For i-Q8C tags only.
member.remarks: The IQ8C has a combined PNP/NPN input to recognise pulses or a high/low status. This input is polled every 2 seconds and when active increments the hour counter in RAM. If the RAM hour counter reaches the value for 6 minutes (1/10 hour), the hour counter in EEPROM is incremented. Also a absolute hour counter(not user writeable) is updated.
member.returns: The total amount of time the engine has been running for.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iCardCF.ReadIQTagUserEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag)
member.summary: Reads the user engine counter value from the tag (6 minute resolution). For i-Q8C tags only.
member.returns: The amount of time the engine has been running for as specified by the user counter.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iCardCF.WriteIQTagUserEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Writes the specified amount of time to the user/trip hour meter. Typically used to set the time back to zero. For i-Q8C tags only.
member.param: The amount of time to reset the user counter to. In a resolution of 6 minutes.
member.remarks: The counter is reported in 6 minute increments (10x per hour). Any value lesser or greater will be rounded.

member.summary: Connects to the first card in the host.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.Connect(System.Int32)
member.summary: Connects to the CF card via a com port (RS-232).
member.remarks: Windows Mobile devices do not require a driver, whereas Windows 2000, XP, 2003 and later require a driver. If the reader is powered by the host, this will power on the reader. Once the reader is powered on, it continuously listens for beaconing tags.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.SetDataLen(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the reader's internal taglist's data length.
member.remarks: You should clear the list after changing the data length!!
member.param: The maximum number of bytes to save. Maximum is 64

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.ResetParams
member.summary: Sets the reader's parameters to default.
member.remarks: Should be done after every connect!!

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.ResetToFactoryDefault
member.summary: This command reset all parameters to default configuration.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.Disconnect
member.summary: Closes the connection to the reader.
member.remarks: If the reader is powered by the host, this call will power off the reader.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.SetTagListBehavior(IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.TagListBehavior)
member.summary: Sets the reader's list behavior.
member.remarks: You should clear the list after changing the list behavior!!

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.GetTagListBehavior
member.summary: Queries the reader for its list behavior.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.GetTags(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the tag list from the reader.
member.param: True to include the tag's detected count since the last call to GetTags or ClearTags.
member.returns: The collection of tags that have been detected.
member.exception: The reader returned the wrong command code.
member.remarks: The DateTime property of the iB2Tag is actually the last time the tag was seen and may not be the current time.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.GetTagsVariableDataLen
member.summary: Gets the tag list from the reader.
member.returns: The collection of tags that have been detected.
member.exception: The reader returned the wrong command code.
member.remarks: The property of the iB2Tag is actually the last time the tag was seen when enableExtendedInfo is enabled and may not be the current time. When enableExtendedInfo is disabled the may not reflect the actual time the tag was detected.
member.exception: The underlying Socket is closed.
The reader did not respond in a timely manner.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.EnableHighRfSensitivity(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables/disables high sensitivty receive.
member.param: True for -85 receive, false for -55 receive
member.remarks: Using this command is recommended over SetRxLevelForTagEntry and SetRxLevelForTagExit as it does not rely on device calibration.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.SetTagSignalFilterLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the tag signal filter level.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.SetTagListInhibitTime(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Tags that have not been detected in longer than the inhibit time and have been reported are removed from the reader's internal list.
member.param: The length of time that the tag remains in the list if it is not detected again. Set to 0 to keep the tag in the list.
member.remarks: The default is 60 seconds when the unit powers up.
The resolution of the reader's timer is in seconds.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.SetTagReReportingInterval(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: The time in seconds after which a tag is re-reported if it is still detected.
member.param: The amount of time after which a tag is re-reported if it is still detected. To disable re-reporting set to 0 (default on power up).
member.remarks: The resolution of the reader's timer is in seconds.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.ClearTagList
member.summary: Removes all tags from the reader's list.
member.remarks: The list is empty on device power-up.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.BeaconReaders.iCardCFB.SetAllTagsInListAsNotYetReported
member.summary: This command causes a resend of all tags in reader memory (schedule for retransmission).
member.returns: True if successful, false if it fails.
member.exception: The underlying Socket is closed.

member.name: T:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreLogLevel
member.summary: Specifies the debug level that will be reported on TCP port 7090 (typically viewed via a telnet connection).
member.remarks: The debug port comes up with a TCP server on port 7090. After connecting to the debug port all the messages printed to the debug port are shown immediately.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreLogLevel.Fatal
member.summary: Fatal situation where the application is unable to continue. e.g. Out of memory.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreLogLevel.Alert
member.summary: Same as fatal for compatibility purpose to the original syslog.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreLogLevel.Critical
member.summary: Critical situation where the application continues to run but the results are more or less senseless. e.g. No interface available.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreLogLevel.Error
member.summary: Normal error situation, e.g. a reader is not responding or not accessible.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreLogLevel.Warning
member.summary: An action is completed successfully but can not further be processed. E.g. internal lists full.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreLogLevel.Notice
member.summary: Notification of some system events. E.g. connection or disconnections from clients.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreLogLevel.Info
member.summary: Informational messages e.g. startup or shutdown messages.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreLogLevel.Debug
member.summary: All messages for debugging the installation.Not recommended for normal usage.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreCommandChannel.SendCustomCommand(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a custom command message to the i-CORE and waits for a response.
member.param: The custom command message to send to the i-CORE.
member.returns: The resulting message from the i-CORE as as string.
member.remarks: You do not have to add the start deliminter ('#'), CRC, or end delimiter ('\r') to your message. For example to send the "GetVersion" command simply pass the string "05" to this method. When the i-CORE responds, the message is parsed and the CRC is checked for validity.This method is provided 'as is' for use with i-CORE capabilities that were not available at the time that this library was built.
member.exception: command is null
command does not contain a command code number
command is not in a format compliant with style
An operating system error occurs while accessing the .
The has been closed.

member.summary: Raised when the i-CORE sends a Heartbeat diagnostics message.

member.name: E:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreCommandChannel.ModularDeviceStatusChanged

member.name: E:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreCommandChannel.TagEvent
member.summary: Raised when a tag event is reported by the i-CORE.
member.remarks: The i-CORE will queue up tag events automatically. These events are only acknowledged if your code subscribes to this event. If this event remains null then acknowledgements are not sent to the i-CORE.

member.name: E:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreCommandChannel.InputTriggered
member.summary: Raised when the input is on the i-CORE's host is triggered. The i-HUB has 2 inputs and i-PORT 3 has 4 inputs.
member.remarks: The i-CORE/i-HUB may also sends trigger events in this style when configured to do so.

member.name: E:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreEventChannel.Disconnected
member.summary: Raised when the TCP connection is disconnected unexpectantly
member.remarks: This event may be raised during normal calls to Disconnect

member.name: E:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreEventChannel.HeartBeat
member.summary: Raised when the i-CORE sends a Heartbeat diagnostics message.
member.remarks: The method the delegate executes runs in a ThreadPool's worker thread and therefore may not be thread safe.

member.name: E:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreEventChannel.ModularDeviceStatusChanged
member.summary: Raised when a module state changes

member.name: E:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreEventChannel.TagEvent
member.summary: Raised when a tag event is reported by the i-CORE.
member.remarks: The i-CORE will queue up tag events automatically. These events are only acknowledged if your code subscribes to this event. If this event remains null then acknowledgements are not sent to the i-CORE.

member.name: E:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreEventChannel.InputTriggered
member.summary: Raised when the input is on the i-CORE's host is triggered. The i-HUB has 2 inputs and i-PORT 3 has 4 inputs.
member.remarks: The i-CORE/i-HUB may also sends trigger events in this style when configured to do so.

member.name: E:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreEventChannel.MessageReceived
member.summary: Raised when a message is received from the i-CORE. Note that your code will be called in a worker thread.

member.name: E:IDENTEC.iCore.iCoreEventChannel.MessageSent
member.summary: Occurs when a message is sent to the i-CORE. Note that your code will be called in a worker thread.

member.summary: The RF frequency. Set this to NA (916.5MHz) or European (868MHz).

member.summary: The receive signal strength the tag was last detected at.
member.remarks: The receive signal strength is only valid after successful tag communications. Use this property only if the tag was detected on a reader with only 1 antenna.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.Tag.BestReceiveAntenna
member.summary: Gets the antenna number with the best signal. Only applicable after communications using a reader that has more than one antenna.
member.remarks: If the tag has not been seen on an antenna then 0 will be returned.

member.summary: The tag serial number (ID) as it appears on the label. For example 0.200.074.790.
member.remarks: You can set the label without having to format the string. For example, 200074790 is valid.

member.remarks: The default is 60 seconds when the unit powers up.

The reader did not respond in a timely manner.

member.name: T:IDENTEC.Readers.iPort3
member.summary: Represents an i-PORT 3 reader controlled remotely.
member.remarks:
The i-PORT must be in "host only" mode. See the "configuration" web page on the i-PORT web interface.
For a static environment or pick-to-light, we recommend the following strategy to ping a tag:
Attempt a ping using the antenna that returned the best signal strength from a scan (when scanning on all antennas)
When a ping fails on the antenna that returned the best RSSI, switch to one of the other three antennas
Continue ping attempts until the ping succeeds
Switch the "best" antenna to the antenna that successfully sent the ping command for subsequent ping attempts (This may not be the same antenna as the antenna reporting the best RSSI)

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iPort3.ReadIQTagAbsoluteEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag)
member.summary: Reads the total hours logged by the tag (6 minute resolution). For i-Q8C tags only.
member.remarks: The IQ8C has a combined PNP/NPN input to recognise pulses or a high/low status. This input is polled every 2 seconds and when active increments the hour counter in RAM. If the RAM hour counter reaches the value for 6 minutes (1/10 hour), the hour counter in EEPROM is incremented. Also a absolute hour counter(not user writeable) is updated.
member.returns: The total amount of time the engine has been running for.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iPort3.ReadIQTagUserEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag)
member.summary: Reads the user engine counter value from the tag (6 minute resolution). For i-Q8C tags only.
member.returns: The amount of time the engine has been running for as specified by the user counter.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iPort3.WriteIQTagUserEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Writes the specified amount of time to the user/trip hour meter. Typically used to set the time back to zero. For i-Q8C tags only.
member.param: The amount of time to reset the user counter to. In a resolution of 6 minutes.
member.remarks: The counter is reported in 6 minute increments (10x per hour). Any value lesser or greater will be rounded.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iPort3.BlinkTag(IDENTEC.Tags.iD2Tag,System.TimeSpan,System.TimeSpan,System.Int32)
member.summary: Invokes the i-D2 tag to blink autonomously by specifying how many blinks and customizing the flashing behavior.
member.exception: The Active Antenna is set to 0.
The underlying Socket is closed.
The server closed the connection.
There is a failure while writing to the network.

If you receive a SocketException, use SocketException.ErrorCode to obtain the specific error code. Once you have obtained this code, you can refer to the Windows Socket Version 2 API error code documentation in MSDN for a detailed description of the error.
The LED off time exceeds 2.55 seconds.
The blink count exceeds 255 seconds.
member.param: The amount of time the tag LED is to stay on (in 10ms steps), maximum of 2.55 seconds.
The amount of time the tag LED is to stay off (in 10ms steps), maximum of 2.55 seconds. 0 for continuous on.
The number of blinks to perform. O to turn off (if already blinking) and 255 maximum.
member.returns: True if successful, false if it fails
member.remarks: With continuous on set, the LED on time is repeated for the blink count. For example 2.55 seconds on time x 255 blinks = 650.25 seconds (nearly 11 minutes).

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.ModularReaderBus.ConnectTCP(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Connects to the daisy chained modular readers.
member.param: The host name on the network or IP address.
The port number the host is configured to use.
member.remarks: The i-PORT R2 does not natively support TCP but if you have a device on the network that converts TCP to serial (and vice versa) then you can use that instead. For example, see www.digi.com for products for wired and wireless solutions. The Connect method will block until it either connects or fails. Note: If you receive a SocketException, use SocketException.ErrorCode to obtain the specific error code. Once you have obtained this code, you can refer to the Windows Socket Version 2 API error code documentation in MSDN for a detailed description of the error.
member.exception: The underlying Socket is closed.
The hostName argument is null.
The underlying Socket is closed.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.ModularReaderBus.Disconnect
member.summary: Closes the communications bus.
member.remarks: No operations are performed directly on the i-PORT R2 readers during disconnect. Only the connection is closed.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iPortMQ.WriteTagDataWithCRCAndLength(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag,System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes data to a tag with a crc and a known length.
member.param: the tag to write formatted data to.
The memory address to store the data.
The number of bytes to write from byData on to the tag.
member.returns: A reference to a TagWriteDataResult object.
member.remarks: A 5 byte header is actually written to the tag at the address specified. If you try to read the data raw at this address, you will read the header. Therefore the actual amount of data you write on the tag is bytesToWrite + 5.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iPortMQ.ReadIQTagAbsoluteEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag)
member.summary: Reads the total hours logged by the tag (6 minute resolution). For i-Q8C tags only.
member.remarks: The IQ8C has a combined PNP/NPN input to recognise pulses or a high/low status. This input is polled every 2 seconds and when active increments the hour counter in RAM. If the RAM hour counter reaches the value for 6 minutes (1/10 hour), the hour counter in EEPROM is incremented. Also a absolute hour counter(not user writeable) is updated.
member.returns: The total amount of time the engine has been running for.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iPortMQ.ReadIQTagUserEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag)
member.summary: Reads the user engine counter value from the tag (6 minute resolution). For i-Q8C tags only.
member.returns: The amount of time the engine has been running for as specified by the user counter.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Readers.iPortMQ.WriteIQTagUserEngineHourCounter(IDENTEC.Tags.iQTag,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Writes the specified amount of time to the user/trip hour meter. Typically used to set the time back to zero. For i-Q8C tags only.
member.param: The amount of time to reset the user counter to. In a resolution of 6 minutes.
member.remarks: The counter is reported in 6 minute increments (10x per hour). Any value lesser or greater will be rounded.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.Logging.LogData.Wrapped
member.summary: The status of the samples on the log. When it is wrapped it means that the time of each sample is calculated from the End time only. When the log is not wrapped then the time of each sample is calculated using the start and end time.
member.remarks: A log is considered wrapped when the number of samples has breached capacity. At this point old samples are overwritten as new samples are added. This means that the Start time is then calculated from the End time.

member.name: T:IDENTEC.Registry
member.summary: Supplies the base RegistryKeys that access values and subkeys in the registry.
member.remarks:
This class provides the set of standard root keys found in the registry on machines running Windows CE. The registry is a storage facility for information about applications and default system settings. For example, applications can use the registry for storing information that needs to be preserved once the application is closed, and access that same information when the application is reloaded. For instance, you can store color preferences, screen locations, or the size of the window. The keys exposed by Registry are:
CurrentUserStores information about user preferences.
LocalMachineStores configuration information for the local machine.
ClassesRootStores information about types (and classes) and their properties.
UsersStores information about the default user configuration. Once you have identified the root key under which you want to store/retrieve information from the registry, you can use the RegistryKey class to add or remove subkeys, and manipulate the values for a given key.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.Registry.LocalMachine
member.summary: Contains the configuration data for the local machine. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.Registry.CurrentUser
member.summary: Contains information about the current user preferences. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CURRENT_USER.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.Registry.ClassesRoot
member.summary: Defines the types (or classes) of documents and the properties associated with those types. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.Registry.Users
member.summary: Contains information about the default user configuration. This field reads the Windows registry base key HKEY_USERS.

member.name: T:IDENTEC.RegistryKey
member.summary: Represents a key level node in the Windows registry. This class is a registry encapsulation.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.RegistryKey.ToString
member.summary: Retrieves a string representation of this key.
member.returns: A string representing the key. If the specified key is invalid (cannot be found) then a null value is returned.
member.exception: The RegistryKey being manipulated is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:IDENTEC.RegistryKey.Flush
member.summary: Writes all the attributes of the specified open registry key into the registry.
member.remarks: The Flush method may also write out parts of or all of the other keys. Calling this function excessively can have a negative effect on an applications performance.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.RegistryKey.Close
member.summary: Closes the key and flushes it to storage if the contents have been modified.
member.remarks: Calling this method on system keys will have no effect, since system keys should never be closed. This method does nothing if you call it on an instance of RegistryKey that is already closed.

member.name: M:IDENTEC.RegistryKey.CreateSubKey(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new subkey or opens an existing subkey. The string subKey is not case-sensitive.
member.param: Name or path of subkey to create or open.
member.returns: Returns the subkey, or null if the operation failed.
member.exception: The specified subkey is null.
The length of the specified subkey is longer than the maximum length allowed (255 characters).
The RegistryKey on which this method is being invoked is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: M:IDENTEC.RegistryKey.CreateSubKey(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates a new subkey or opens an existing subkey. The string subKey is not case-sensitive.
New in v1.3

The length of the specified subkey is longer than the maximum length allowed (255 characters).
The RegistryKey on which this method is being invoked is closed (closed keys cannot be accessed).

member.name: T:IDENTEC.RegistryValueKind
member.summary:
Specifies the data types to use when storing values in the registry, or identifies the data type of a value in the registry.
New in v1.3
member.remarks:
The RegistryValueKind enumeration defines the set of supported registry data types and the value that is used for unsupported types (Unknown).
Use the method to determine the data type of a registry key value before retrieving the value. When you set a registry key value, use the RegistryKey.SetValue method to specify the registry data type explicitly.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.RegistryValueKind.Unknown
member.summary: Indicates an unsupported registry data type. Use this value to specify that SetValue should determine the appropriate registry data type when storing a name/value pair.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.RegistryValueKind.String
member.summary: Specifies a null-terminated string. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_SZ.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.RegistryValueKind.ExpandString
member.summary: Specifies a null-terminated string that contains unexpanded references to environment variables, such as %PATH%, that are expanded when the value is retrieved. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_EXPAND_SZ.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.RegistryValueKind.Binary
member.summary: Specifies binary data in any form. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_BINARY.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.RegistryValueKind.DWord
member.summary: Specifies a 32-bit binary number. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_DWORD.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.RegistryValueKind.MultiString
member.summary: Specifies an array of null-terminated strings, terminated by two null characters. This value is equivalent to the Win32 API registry data type REG_MULTI_SZ.

member.summary: Create a DetailedPortSettings class

member.summary: These are the default port settings override Init() to create new defaults (i.e. common handshaking)

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.BasicSettings
member.summary: Basic port settings

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.OutCTS
member.summary: Specifies if the CTS (clear-to-send) signal is monitored for output flow control. If this member is TRUE and CTS is turned off, output is suspended until CTS is sent again.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.OutDSR
member.summary: Specifies if the DSR (data-set-ready) signal is monitored for output flow control. If this member is TRUE and DSR is turned off, output is suspended until DSR is sent again.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.DTRControl
member.summary: Specifies the DTR (data-terminal-ready) flow control.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.DSRSensitive
member.summary: Specifies if the communications driver is sensitive to the state of the DSR signal. If this member is TRUE, the driver ignores any bytes received, unless the DSR modem input line is high.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.TxContinueOnXOff
member.summary: Specifies if transmission stops when the input buffer is full and the driver has transmitted the XoffChar character. If this member is TRUE, transmission continues after the input buffer has come within XoffLim bytes of being full and the driver has transmitted the XoffChar character to stop receiving bytes. If this member is FALSE, transmission does not continue until the input buffer is within XonLim bytes of being empty and the driver has transmitted the XonChar character to resume reception.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.OutX
member.summary: Specifies if XON/XOFF flow control is used during transmission. If this member is TRUE, transmission stops when the XoffChar character is received and starts again when the XonChar character is received.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.InX
member.summary: Specifies if XON/XOFF flow control is used during reception. If this member is TRUE, the XoffChar character is sent when the input buffer comes within XoffLim bytes of being full, and the XonChar character is sent when the input buffer comes within XonLim bytes of being empty

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.ReplaceErrorChar
member.summary: Specifies if bytes received with parity errors are replaced with the character specified by the ErrorChar member. If this member is TRUE and the fParity member is TRUE, replacement occurs.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.RTSControl
member.summary: Specifies the RTS (request-to-send) flow control. If this value is zero, the default is RTS_CONTROL_HANDSHAKE. The following table shows possible values for this member.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.DiscardNulls
member.summary: Specifies if null bytes are discarded. If this member is TRUE, null bytes are discarded when received.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.AbortOnError
member.summary: Specifies if read and write operations are terminated if an error occurs. If this member is TRUE, the driver terminates all read and write operations with an error status if an error occurs. The driver will not accept any further communications operations until the application has acknowledged the error by calling the ClearError function.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.XonChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the XON character for both transmission and reception

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.XoffChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the XOFF character for both transmission and reception.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.ErrorChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the character used to replace bytes received with a parity error.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.EOFChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the character used to signal the end of data.

member.name: F:IDENTEC.DetailedPortSettings.EVTChar
member.summary: Specifies the value of the character used to signal an event.

member.summary: The maximum signal that the tag was seen at if the tag was detected multiple times by the reader.

member.summary: Gets the detected count (how many times the reader saw the tag since the last reader query.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2Tag.FirstSeen
member.summary: The first time the tag was seen.
member.remarks: This time is relative to the last time the call was made to the i-PORT R2. This value is only valid after making a call to the i-PORT R2's Get Tags with the extended option set to true.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2Tag.LowByteAgeCount
member.summary: A count to help estimate communication assurance.
member.remarks: This byte counts up by one every telegram (0 - 255).

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2Tag.HighByteAgeCount
member.summary: A count to help estimate tag life.
member.remarks: This byte counts up by one roughly once every 1 million telegrams (12 days @ 1 second ping rate).

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2Tag.Flags
member.summary: The flags that were set on the tag.
member.remarks: Note that the Flags are actually only 1 byte, but we expose this property in this assembly as an integer so that it is CLSCompliant.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2Tag.Battery
member.summary: Gets the tag battery status.
member.remarks: If the tag has not been seen on an antenna then 0 will be returned.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2Tag.ProtocolID
member.summary: Gets the tag Protocol ID.

member.summary: The raw data of the telegram

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2Tag.LoopData
member.summary: The loop information reported by i-B2L tags. If the tag does not have any loop data returns null

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2Tag.AnntennaInfo
member.summary: Lists the antenna information for each antenna that detected the tag.

member.name: T:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2AntennaDetection
member.summary: Represents the information reported by each antenna on the reader.
member.remarks: Relevant when used with the .

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2AntennaDetection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new iB2AntennaDetection instance

member.name: M:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2AntennaDetection.#ctor(IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2AntennaDetection)
member.summary: Copy constructor to initialize from an existing instance

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2AntennaDetection.AntennaNumber
member.summary: The reader antenna number the tag was detected on.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2AntennaDetection.FirstSeen
member.summary: The first time the tag was detected by the reader since the last query from the host.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2AntennaDetection.LastSeen
member.summary: The last time the tag was detected by the reader since the last query from the host.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2AntennaDetection.Signal
member.summary: The most current signal as detected by the reader.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2AntennaDetection.SignalMax
member.summary: The maximum signal as detected by the reader since the last query from the host.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2AntennaDetection.DetectionCount
member.summary: The number of times the reader detected the tag since the last query. If it is 0 then the tag was not detected on the specified antenna.
member.remarks: Up to a maximum of 255.

member.name: P:IDENTEC.Tags.BeaconTags.iB2AntennaDetection.EstimatedBeaconRate
member.summary: Estimates the beacon interval based on the first and last times the tag was seen with the number of times the tag was detected.
